info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 8:10AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...Oklahoma...
Red River near Gainesville affecting Cooke and Love Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Red River near Gainesville.
* WHEN...From this evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Crop and range lands... pecan groves... oil wells... and rural roads are flooded or isolated. Low-lying fields... upstream in western Love County in Oklahoma... and Cooke County in Texas... experience overflows several hours before the crest reaches the Interstate Highway I-35 crossing north of Gainesville. Sandpit operations area affected. Livestock and other property should be removed to places which are at least 3 feet higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The Red River is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to a crest of 27.8 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
